document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: FN: reflecting or shining small quantities of individual, separate points of light.

sentence.text: Hardly a glittering array of stars , they 're backing more losers than SLY STALLONE â€¦
As dusk falls a glittering array of discos , jazz clubs , night clubs and casinos add their names to the town 's neon nightscape .
The old man with the skinny hand and glittering eye , the ancient mariner , was telling his tale in the past tense .
An upper-class homosexual-looking man with white hair and glittering eyes came up to me and asked if I wanted to go to a Black Mass .
A fool with a glittering eye dreaming of a golden paradise beyond the western edge of things .
His voice was low and controlled , but his hands were clenched at his sides and his glittering eyes would have frozen hell-fire .
The other was shorter , big-chested , with black hair , black chin and deepset , glittering eyes .
A 13-YEAR-OLD maths genius with a Mensa IQ just one short of the maximum 178 has beaten 30,000 rivals to win a glittering prize .
They presented him with his glittering prize -- a gold and diamond lapel pin -- at the National Exhibition Centre in Birmingham .
He started out as a full-back with Bath and looked set for the glittering prizes .
Tom Gibson collected the glittering prizes , but he undervalued his contribution to his own area of medicine .
Ruth sat silent on the stern thwart as the Drowned Forest receded and the boat went out over the glittering water , into emptiness .
But the daggers had remained sheathed during the meal , and she had allowed her thoughts to drift into those glittering waters .
With lungs clutching for oxygen , we looked up from our darkness to the glittering peaks of Kanchenjunga , Sikkim 's holy mountain , sparkling in the early sunrise .
This man , eager to draw first blood , swerved as he neared Sharpe , then leaned out of his saddle to give a gut-slicing sweep with the glittering blade .
In the evenings , the restaurant offers a glittering panoramic view of the lake .
The girl wore a low-cut red dress -- not unlike mine at home , she mused -- very high heels , and lots of glittering accessories .
Gold â€¦ beautiful , bright , glittering , glistening , lovely yellow gold !

As in a fairy-story , when the great man entered the room where the models were displayed , his eyes fell immediately on the glittering and finely crafted work of the youngest and least known of the competitors .
SINCE the presidential campaign , when Al Gore banged on about about a glittering new ` information superhighway " , few topics have generated as much fevered chatter .
The living room was all decorated , with a tall , glittering Christmas tree at the far end , and a welcoming log fire crackled in the fireplace .
New construction in the past 10 years has changed the city 's skyline ; with new , glittering hotels and highrise apartment blocks , the city is beginning to look a little more like Hong Kong .
